result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Luis Ott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$449.00 to be paid to Walmart.

**12-16-2015/ Judge William S Pocan**
The Court ordered restitution in the amounts of $12,575.00 to  be paid to Dr. Abdul S. and $800.00 to be paid to Micheale O.   To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Pay all coss, surcharges and restitution including mandatory DNA surcharge. To be paid out of up to 25% of prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. 
*Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two (2) years Initial Confinement in cases 15CF531, 15CF989 and 15CM677.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illeal drugs.  No controleld substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.
No contact with Compassionate Doctor's Inc. located at 1672 S. 9 Street, Milwaukee, WI.; Walmart located at 3355 S. 27 Street, Milwaukee, WI; Blue Kangaroo Laundromat located at 1115 W. Greenfield Ave, Milwaukee, WI., Econo Lodge located at 6541 S.  13 Street, Milwaukee, WI.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $34.00 witness fees for witness Addul S. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191002 in court 2x on 10/20/15, 12/16/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Addul S. was approved for ONLY 2 appearances on 10/20/15, 12/16/15 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Addul S. . will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Reflects 12-16-15 Court order for (additional) restitution

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  *.  
Restitution hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Dr. Abdul Sulieman.  Sworn for defense: Joseph Ott.   State and defense rest.  Arguments by state and defense.  Restitution is ordered in the amounts of $12575.00 to be paid to Dr. Abdul Sulieman and $800.00 to be paid to Micheale O., to be paid out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for restitution hearing.  Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings.    Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26.  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Original SENTENCING STATUS CONFERENCE Transcript (52 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 2, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for restitution hearing to determine restitution amount for Compassionate Doctor's Inc., in Branch 26.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Carolina L.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 3.5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1.5 year with credit for 221 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Compassionate Doctor's Inc. located at 1672 S. 9th St., Milwaukee, WI., Walmart located at 3355 S. 27th St. Milwaukee, WI., Blue Kangaroo Laundromat located at 1115 W. Greenfield Ave. Milwaukee, WI., Econo Lodge located at 6541 S. 13th St. Milwaukee, WI.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is stipulated and ordered in the amount of $449.00 to be paid to Walmart.

- Defendant to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in cases 15CF531, 15CF989 and 15CM677.

Appeal rights given.    
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
The Court modified the current no contact order to allow defendant to have contact with Maribel J.  All other conditions of the no contact order remain the same.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed.
filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel in court and requests jury trial.  Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Letter from friend on behalf of the defendant filed.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, Defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for Tyrone Martin St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, Defendant Joseph Luis Ott not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. State will be charging Defendant with additional cases. Defendant will not be produced for purposes of the next hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Ron Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with COMPASSIONATE DOCTOR'S INC.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW) INCLUDING ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Joseph Luis Ott in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
